item.title: Illegal Poster, 19th August
item.description:
On North Cray Road, Bexley: Please could you remove an illegal poster advertising plumbing services on a Council’s street light column (heading from Bexley Village towards Sidcup). I had already reported this on here however your contractor has marked my report as being resolved when it hasn’t. Please remove it. https://fix.bexley.gov.uk/report/8034879
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Cray Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 19th August
item.description:
On Arnsberg Way, Bexleyheath: A grey Vauxhall Corsa has been dumped outside Bexleyheath Police Station. The car is accumulating parking fines on its windscreen. Please could you investigate and if possible remove it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Arnsberg Way, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight on path connecting Bath Close and Laburnum Close not working, 19th August
item.description:
The streetlight on the path connecting Bath Close and Laburnum Close is not working. Given it provides illumination to part of the covered passageway and the patch of grass nearby, this not working could increase antisocial behaviour in the area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Laburnum Close, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footway obstructed by hedge on Bigwood Road, 19th August
item.description:
On the south-western corner of Bigwood Road and Southway NW11, the hedge growing on the boundary of the corner property has been allowed to overgrow so far past the boundary fence that it is now seriously obstructing the public's use of the footway. It is barely possible to walk along this side of Bigwood Road without having to lean over towards the kerb. Even then, people are having to walk on what is intended to be a strip of grass between the paving stones and the kerbstones, but which is now completely bare as a result of the foot traffic. It is not wheelchair accessible. Please cut the hedge to the line of the wooden fence, to allow this footway to be used properly once again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southway, Hampstead Garden Suburb, London
Report on FixMyStreet
